title: After asset quality hit, small finance banks to sharpen risk controls for 2026

title: Swiggy sees FII, mutual fund buying for third consecutive quarter. Time to buy the dip?

title: Metal stocks: Get the reason right or you might … later: 7 metal stocks from different segments with upside potential up to 31%
summary: Metal stocks are looking attractive at a time when the markets are bearish. Remember though, this has happened in the past. A similar trend was seen in October 2024, only the narrative was different. Then it was about an economic recovery in China. The perception was strengthened as the Chinese markets did well in October-November that year. A correlation was made between the market doing well and expectations of recovery, leading metal stocks to rise. But we all know what happened. So, if you are lured by headlines about metal stocks doing well in a bearish market, get your reason right for buying them.

title: BofA takes a measured view on Meesho’s next phase, starts coverage with 'neutral' rating; stock sheds 5%

title: Stock Market Holiday: BSE, NSE to remain closed for trading on January 15 for Maharashtra municipal elections
summary: Stock Market Holidays 2026: Stock exchanges BSE and NSE will be closed for trading on January 15 due to municipal corporation elections in Maharashtra. Equity derivatives contracts set to expire on January 15, 2026, have been moved to January 14. This change impacts trading in equity, derivatives, commodity, and gold receipts segments.

title: Stock market holiday: BSE, NSE to be closed for trading on January 15 — Here's why

title: These large-caps have ‘strong buy’ & ‘buy’ recos and an upside potential of more than 26%
summary: In the last few days, a strange thing has happened. The attention of the street has shifted from the Q3 earnings season to the outcome of the India-US trade deal. In the short term, the market’s attention may be impacted by many things, including diplomatic postures and statements, the likes of which we saw in the past few days. Ultimately, however, it is earnings that matter. So, today or tomorrow, the street will look at what is happening to steel prices, polymer prices, or whether the capex cycle of a company is over. As an investor, focus on sectors where government policies have begun to show impact.
